intro: Gilia debilis var. larsenii, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
